data.1: I CALL TO WITNESS those who dive and drag,
data.2: And those who undo the bonds gently,
data.6: The day the convulsive (first blast) shatters convulsively
data.8: Hearts will pound loudly on that day,
data.10: They say: "Shall we go back to our original state
data.11: After having turned to carious bones?"
data.12: They say: "Then this returning will be a dead loss."
data.13: It will only be a single blast,
data.14: And they will wake up suddenly.
data.15: Has the story of Moses come to you
data.16: When his Lord called to him in Tuwa´s holy vale?
data.17: "Go to the Pharaoh who has become refractory,
data.18: And say: ´Would you like to grow (in virtue)?
data.19: Then I will guide you to your Lord that you may come to fear Him.´"
data.20: So he showed him the greater sign;
data.24: Saying: "I am alone your lord, the highest of them all."
data.25: So God seized him for the punishment of the Hereafter and this world.
data.26: Truly there is a lesson in this for those who fear (the consequences).
data.27: Are you more difficult to create or the heavens? He built it,
data.29: Gave darkness to its night, and brightness to its day;
data.30: And afterwards spread out the earth.
data.31: He brought out its water and its pastures from it,
data.33: As convenience for you and your cattle.
data.35: The day when man remembers all that he had done,
data.36: And Hell made visible to him who can see,
data.37: Then he who had been rebellious
data.38: And who preferred the life of the world,
data.39: Will surely have Hell for his abode.
data.40: But he who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained his self from vain desires,
data.41: Will surely have Paradise for abode.
data.42: They ask you: "When will the Hour be? When is its time fixed?"
data.43: What do you have to do with explaining it?
data.44: The extent of its knowledge goes to your Lord.
data.45: Your duty is only to warn him who fears it.
data.46: The day they see it, it will seem they had stayed in the world but only an evening or its turning into dawn.
